recipes.name: Neapolatin Pizza
recipes.description:
Tasty, chewy and crispy is what we all need.
'Theres no such thing as a bad pizza' üçïü•¥ü§£
Whether you believe in this myth or not...
Making the perfect pizza is a bit tricky...
It starts with a 500-950¬∞F oven and this recipe!
Recipe credits go to the Ooni test kitchen!
instructions: Prepare warm water (bring 1/3 of your water to a boil and mix with remaining water)
When the whater is lukewarm, add your yeast and salt
Add this mixture into a large mixing bowl and knead for 10 min
Cover dough with plastic wrap and/or damp kitchen towel and leave to rise for 2hrs
Once dough has roughly doubled in size, split the dough balls up into roughly 240g balls for a 10-12 inch pizza
Roll divided dough into round balls and let rest (covered) for 15 - 20 minutes
Flatten it out with your fingers, starting in the center pushing the tiny little gas bubbles towards a 1-2 cm crust
At this point it is a subjective free for all... Sauce it up with tomatoe, alfredo or even BBQ base and add your desired toppings!
My philosophy is the simpler the pizza the better... ENJOY!

recipes.name: Lebanese Garlic Sauce
recipes.description:
About 4 years ago I was introduced...
I've been making it almost monthly ever since.
I've travelled far around the Middle-East...
And by far, it's the most simple and tastiest.
Let me know what you try it on!
My favourites are on chicken and pizza ü§§
Recipe credit go to the beautiful Lody!
instructions: Squeeze the lemons, collect the juice in a bowl and cut the brown ends off your garlic cloves
Using a food processer with a feed tube, pulse your garlic until most pieces are stuck on the walls, then scrape down

Ok so at this point you need to have all your ingredients ready because when we turn on the processor it should not turn off until we are done.
We want to emulsify the oil and garlic together and that can only be done by SLOWLY adding in the oil. Most food processors come with a small hole
in the feedtube for this process, if you dont have it no worries, pour the oil as thin as a fine thread
We will add in our oil in batches of 1/3 cups. So go a head, and add a little oil and then turn on the machine
Once the 1/3 of a cup of oil has been incorperated, add 1-2 tsp of the lemon juice - Repeat this stip until all the oil is incorperated
Finally turn off your machine, and add your salt to taste. If you find the garlic too 'spicy'üò≠ add 1/2 - 1 cup of more oil next time
Because of the simple ingredients, the sauce will last over a month in the fridge! Enjoy your garlic breath my friends! üòÆ‚Äçüí®üíÄ

recipes.name: Pita bread
recipes.description:
Not much beats fresh bread...
Expecially when you make it yourself!
The perfect pita pocket recipe is here!
Rip it and dip it or turn it into a utensil. üòé
Pair with hummus, babaghanoush or Lebnah.
Shawarma wraps with my Garlic Sauce...üòç
Recipe credits go to David at the NY Times!
instructions: Prepare warm water (bring 1/3 of your water to a boil and mix with remaining water)
Add yeast and sugar to water and let sit for 15 minutes in a warm place
Combine the mixture with all the whole-wheat flour, all-purpose flower, olive oil and salt
Mix with a wooden spoon until a shaggy mass, then knead in the bowl for 1 minute
Once most of the stray bits have been incorperated, turn dough out onto work surface and knead lightly for 2 minutes
Once the dough forms a smooth surface, let it rest for 10 minutes and knead again for 2 minutes
Get a clean mixing bowl and place the dough inside, covering with either plastic wrap or a towel
Wait 1-2hrs for the dough to double in size, this step varies depending on temperature and flour used
At this point we want to preheat our vessel... Preheat your oven at 475¬∞F with a baking tray or cast iron pan (or cook on a hot stove top)
Punch your dough in the mouth and split it into roughly 80g balls, be sure to flour your work surface before rolling out into 6in discs
Place the discs on the vessel swiftly but carefuly and place in the oven for 2 minutes, we are looking for a nice puff
Turn over to the other side and bake for one more minute, and place warm pita in a towel to absorb the moisture and to stay soft
Enjoy my friends üôÉ

recipes.name: Semi-Sweat Corn Bread
recipes.description:
You may ask how did corn bread end up here??
In 2014 I had the pleasure of visiting NOLA ‚öúÔ∏è
This was the one that I couldnt let get away...
It goes great with any sort of hearty BBQ üçñ
Make sure to eat it while is warm, so reheat it!
My favourite way is with some honey & butter.
üòãüòãüòã
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F and melt down the butter in your skillet
Whisk all your dry then wet ingredients in seperate bowls
Whisk roughly half the cooled down butter into the wet ingredients
Slowly and gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients
Place the batter into the skillet with the remaining butter
Place the skillet in the pre-heated oven and wait about 23 minutes

When you suspect its done, insert a toothpick into the center.
If it comes out clean with nothing stuck to it, it is ready!
Let it cool for 10 minutes on a baking rack or in the pan.
Tradition is to always add some extra butter on top. üòé
